item.title: FT Weekend Festival: US Edition（FT周末音乐节：美国版）即将来临，购买早鸟通行证的时间仅剩*3天。现在就购买通行证，与杰克-沙利文（Jake Sullivan）、古奇-韦斯特曼（Gucci Westman）、安妮-阿普尔鲍姆（Anne Applebaum）、扬西丝-罗宾逊（Jancis Robinson）等人一起参加5月4日在华盛顿特区举办的活动（或在线购买
item.description:
FT Weekend Festival: US Edition is fast approaching and there are only *3 days left* to buy your earlybird passes. Secure yours now to join Jake Sullivan, Gucci Westman, Anne Applebaum, Jancis Robinson and many more on May 4 in Washington DC (or online) https://t.co/gfqPOwaZ9n pic.twitter.com/UacZCZpINr

— Financial Times (@FT) March 16, 2024

item.title: 埃德温-希斯科特写道："随着邮票和贝壳收藏的消亡，发现自己一无所有的不仅仅是爱好者，我们的家庭也受到了负面影响--'失去了他们曾经拥有的奇怪的痴迷和狂热的收藏'"。
item.description:
As collecting stamps and seashells dies out, it’s not just hobbyists that are finding themselves bereft — our homes have been negatively affected too, writes Edwin Heathcote, – 'shorn of the strange obsessions and fanatical collections they once had' https://t.co/Yf9FqXYIFV

— Financial Times (@FT) March 16, 2024

item.title: Viet Thanh Nguyen 是少数以处女作获得普利策小说奖的小说家之一。在与 @lilahrap 共进午餐时，他谈到了童年离开越南、颠覆移民回忆录，以及他为什么相信世界是无国界的。
item.description:
Viet Thanh Nguyen is one of few novelists to win a Pulitzer prize in fiction for a debut. Over Lunch with the FT with @lilahrap he talks about leaving Vietnam as a child, subverting the immigrant memoir — and why he believes in a borderless world https://t.co/D37KyKCZqn

— Financial Times (@FT) March 16, 2024
